CARDINAL . ORG for the Prevention of Torture has visited GPE several times , and has inspected LOC police station . The following extract , taken from the report of the visit of DATE , is relevant to the present case :

“ CARDINAL . The right of persons in police custody to have access to a doctor ( including to CARDINAL of their own choice ) , is still not expressly guaranteed by law . Many persons who were in police custody in the context of the DATE events complained that , despite repeated requests for independent medical assistance , they had been refused such assistance . In some cases , police staff allegedly denied access to a doctor in order to obtain a confession or other statement from the injured detained persons concerned . Further , it appeared in a few cases of persons who had presented visible injuries that medical care had not been provided to them on the grounds that they had not specifically requested it .
